verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician, <WH5329> even to Jeduthun, <WH3038> A Psalm <WH4210> of David. <WH1732> I said, <WH559> I will take heed <WH8104> to my ways, <WH1870> that I sin <WH2398> not with my tongue: <WH3956> I will keep <WH8104> my mouth <WH6310> with a bridle, <WH4269> while <WH5750> the wicked <WH7563> is before <WH5048> me.
I was dumb <WH481> with silence, <WH1747> I held <WH2814> my peace, <WH2814> even from good; <WH2896> and my sorrow <WH3511> was stirred. <WH5916>
My heart <WH3820> was hot <WH2552> within <WH7130> me, while I was musing <WH1901> the fire <WH784> burned: <WH1197> then spoke <WH1696> I with my tongue, <WH3956>
LORD, <WH3068> make me to know <WH3045> my end, <WH7093> and the measure <WH4060> of my days, <WH3117> what <WH4310> it is: that I may know <WH3045> how <WH4100> frail <WH2310> I am.

Behold, <WH2009> you have made <WH5414> my days <WH3117> as an handbreadth; <WH2947> and my age <WH2465> is as nothing <WH369> before <WH5048> you: truly <WH389> every <WH3605> man <WH120> at his best <WH5324> state <WH5324> is altogether <WH3605> vanity. <WH1892> Selah. <WH5542>

Surely <WH389> every man <WH376> walks <WH1980> in a vain show: <WH6754> surely <WH389> they are disquieted <WH1993> in vain: <WH1892> he heaps <WH6651> up riches, and knows <WH3045> not who <WH4310> shall gather <WH622> them.
And now, <WH6258> Lord, <WH136> what <WH4100> wait <WH6960> I for? my hope <WH8431> is in you.
Deliver <WH5337> me from all <WH3605> my transgressions: <WH6588> make <WH7760> me not the reproach <WH2781> of the foolish. <WH5036>
I was dumb, <WH481> I opened <WH6605> not my mouth; <WH6310> because <WH3588> you did <WH6213> it.
Remove <WH5493> your stroke <WH5061> away from me: I am consumed <WH3615> by the blow <WH8409> of your hand. <WH3027>

When you with rebukes <WH8433> do correct <WH3256> man <WH376> for iniquity, <WH5771> you make his beauty <WH2530> to consume <WH4529> away like a moth: <WH6211> surely <WH389> every <WH3605> man <WH120> is vanity. <WH1892> Selah. <WH5542>

Hear <WH8085> my prayer, <WH8605> O LORD, <WH3068> and give ear <WH238> to my cry; <WH7775> hold <WH2790> not your peace <WH2790> at <WH413> my tears: <WH1832> for I am a stranger <WH1616> with you, and a sojourner, <WH8453> as all <WH3605> my fathers <WH1> were.
O spare <WH8159> me, that I may recover <WH1082> strength, <WH1082> before <WH2962> I go <WH3212> hence, <WH2088> and be no <WH369> more.
